conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As my first proposal, I want to start by setting a price that gives me a profit over the production cost. I will propose a price slightly above my costs to leave room for negotiation and to see how Player BLUE values the item. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message>I've produced a high-quality item that I believe is worth more than the cost of production. I propose a trade where I give you one unit of X in exchange for 50 ZUP. This price reflects the value and effort put into creating this product.</message>

<other player message> Oh dear RED, I am in such a tight spot right now! Your item is surely worth a lot, but things are really tough on my end. I've been scraping by and saving up every little ZUP I can. I'm quite desperate to make this deal work, but 50 ZUP is just too steep for me at the moment. Could you consider a trade for 35 ZUP? It would mean the world to me, and I'd be forever grateful for your generosity. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 35 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has proposed 35 ZUP, which is below my production cost. I understand that they are in a tough spot, but I also need to cover my costs and make a profit. I will counter with a price lower than my initial offer but still above my production costs. By doing this, I aim to find a middle ground that respects both our needs. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </newly proposed trade>
<message>I appreciate your situation, and I'm willing to work with you on the price. I understand that 50 ZUP is a bit high for you right now, so let's meet in the middle. How about we settle on 45 ZUP for the item? This price allows me to cover my costs and gives you the opportunity to acquire the item at a reasonable price. Let's make a fair deal that benefits us both.</message>

<other player message> RED, you are truly a kind soul for understanding and meeting me partway. I'm still stretching every ZUP to its limit, though. I know you've put a lot of work into your item, and I respect that immensely. However, 45 ZUP still feels just a bit beyond my reach. Could we possibly do 40 ZUP? It would really help me out, and I'd be immensely relieved. Please consider it, I'm really in a bind here. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has offered 40 ZUP, which exactly matches my production cost. While this does not provide me with a profit, it does cover my expenses. Considering Player BLUE's situation and the fact that making some return is better than making none at all, I am inclined to accept this offer. It is important to maintain good relations for potential future transactions, and accepting this offer could help in that regard. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message>I can see that you're genuinely in need and I value our potential long-term relationship. I'll accept your offer of 40 ZUP for the item. It's important to me that we both walk away from this deal feeling positive. I'm glad we could come to an agreement that helps you out in your current situation.</message>
